Comment:
This is my first annotation here on GK.  This particular game was a lot of fun...  a Kieseritsky gambit, a poisoned pawn, and a pretty checkmate (well, pretty for us  hanging around 1450!)  Enjoy...

As white, I'm a fan of e4.
Standard reply.
The King's Gambit leads to many sharp lines.
Accepting the gambit is generally considered to be the best reply.
Defending the pawn, but weakening the kingside.
Defending the pawn, but weakening the kingside.
And we've arrived at the classic position of the Kieseritsky gambit, where White threatens to win back the lost pawn.
And we've arrived at the classic position of the Kieseritsky gambit, where White threatens to win back the lost pawn.
And we've arrived at the classic position of the Kieseritsky gambit, where White threatens to win back the lost pawn.
!?  Interesting.  Black doesn't accept the loss of the pawn, and sends the brave soldier to the sixth rank to put pressure on f2.  I'm going to have to be careful not to allow him to exploit it.
Taking control of the center, and threatening to win the pawn at f4.
?!  Huh?  I would have expected Black to play ..d6 to drive off the knight, or ..d5 to fight for the center.  Instead he brings out his queen to threaten my knight, which has a defender...
... and now has two.  I can now win the pawn at g3 at my leisure.

Ahhhhh!  So THAT'S what her majesty decided to come out and play for!  Black has my b2 pawn caught undefended, and has an eye out for more-- indeed, after Qxb2, my rook is trapped and helpless.  But I had a sense at this point that if Black DID gobble my pawn, I would actually be in a stronger position!

Freeing and defending the rook.  Take a look at the position.  White has 3 pieces out, including a centralized knight, while Black has only the lonely queen out pawn-hunting.  Still, good defense might have salvaged the game, at least for a little while...
... but instead, Black goes for the undefended b-pawn.  OM NOM NOM NOM
Defends the knight.  I can now win the queen with Nc4!
Qa3 serves the same purpose.  Time for her majesty to get outta Dodge...
!  Ouch.  "Your majesty, you don't look well.  Perhaps it was that poisoned pawn  you ate?"
The only safe square.
"Hey, fork you, man!"
Mmm, rookalicious.
Mmm, rookalicious.

?  Wait, you're down in material, and you want to offer an exchange that gives me a check?!  Weird... though, I can SORTA see the logic behind it, he attacks d4 and if I did exchange, he would threaten e4...
